Control: SQL Server Network Protocol - Named Pipes
SQL Server Network Protocol - Shared Memory
SQL Server Network Protocol - TCP/IP Port Number
All Database data Files in K drive
All Database T-log Files in L drive
All Tempdb Files in P drive
Ad Hoc Distributed Queries - (Expected Result : Disabled)
Cross DB Ownership Chaining - (Expected Result : Disabled)
Scan for startup Procs - (Expected Result : Disabled)
MaxDop Settings(8 or less cores, MaxDOP = half the number of cores. More than 8 cores, MaxDOP = 8)
TempDB Files - (8 cores or less, no. of tempdb files = no. of cores. More than 8 cores, no. of tempdb files = 8)
SQLServer Maintenance Jobs Deployed (Script checks for keywords 'Index' & 'Integrity' in job-step commands)
CHECK_EXPIRATION Option set for SQL Logins with sysadmin role (Expected Result : Yes)
CHECK POLICY Option set for SQL Logins (Expected Result : Yes)
Server Added to appropriate patching Group
VM Standards: Enhanced vMotion Compatibility (EVC Mode) - (Expected Result : Disabled)
VM Standards: BIOS/UEFI Settings - Turbo Boost (Expected Result : Enabled)
VM Standards: BIOS/UEFI Settings - Hyper Threading (Expected Result : Enabled)
VM Standards: BIOS/UEFI Settings - NUMA (Expected Result : Enabled)
VM Standards: BIOS/UEFI Settings - CPU Advanced Features (VT-x,EPT,RVI) (Expected Result : Enabled)
VM Standards: BIOS/UEFI Settings - Select appropriate Snoop Mode (not a configurable setting on Dell PowerEdge servers)
VM Standards: BIOS/UEFI Settings - Select Power Management to "OS Controlled"
VM Standards: BIOS/UEFI Settings - Processor C-states (including the C1E Halt State) (Expected Result : Disabled)
VM Standards: BIOS/UEFI Settings - QPI Power Management (Expected Result : Disabled)
VM Standards: vCPU Configuration - CPU Hot Plug (Expected Result : Disabled)
VM Standards: vCPU Configuration - CPU Affinity - Do NOT Use
VM Standards: Memory Configuration - Reserve 100% Memory provisioned to VM

VM Standards: Memory Configuration - If Memory Provisioned to VM >= 50% of ESXi Host Memory (aka Unbalanced vNUMA) Add VM Advanced setting (numa.vcpu.maxPerMachineNode = (Number of vCPU assigned to VM) / 2)
VM Standards: Memory Configuration - If Memory Provisioned to VM >= 50% of ESXi Host Memory (aka Unbalanced vNUMA) Configure CoresPerSocket (coresPerSocket = numa.vcpu.maxPerMachineNode)
